# hidesBackButton

**Instance Property**

A Boolean value that determines whether the navigation item hides the Back button.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var hidesBackButton: Bool { get set }
```

## Discussion

When set to [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true], the Back button is hidden when this navigation item is the top item. This is true regardless of the value in the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UINavigationItem/leftItemsSupplementBackButton] property. When set to [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false], the Back button is shown if it’s still present. (It can be replaced by values in either the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UINavigationItem/leftBarButtonItem] or [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UINavigationItem/leftBarButtonItems] properties.) The default value is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false].

## Related Documentation

- **backItem**: The navigation item that is immediately below the topmost item on a navigation bar’s stack.

## Configuring the Back button

- **backBarButtonItem**: The bar button item for adding a Back button to the navigation bar.
- **backButtonTitle**: The custom title of the Back button.
- **backButtonDisplayMode**: The display mode of the Back button.
- **UINavigationItem.BackButtonDisplayMode**: Constants that describe the display modes of the Back button.
- **setHidesBackButton(_:animated:)**: Hides or shows the Back button, optionally animating the transition.
- **backAction**: The back action for the navigation bar.
